name: Tarallucci e Vino Upper West Side
address: 475 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: Fantastic, nothing will be like my home but it was very close.
Disfrutamos mucho el desayuno con platillos muy bien servidos y sazonados. Recomendadisimo.
It was great. The pasta and the fish was great, we got got our food quickly and the waiters are very nice. Everyone was having a good time.I loved the food and I think everyone should visit there
Absolutely delicious and just wonderful all around
Chicken was very dry and plain . The house white however was very crisp and for happy hour price can‚Äôt beat it.

I had a TERRIBLE experience. I would give 0 stars if I could! I book a table for 9:45 PM. They rushed us through our dinner. My pasta was bland and cold. They didn‚Äôt have any bread left. Late reservations shouldn‚Äôt be offered if the kitchen closes at 10:30 and the restaurant at11:00. This restaurant is overpriced and the food was bad.
The food is super expensive the drinks are not good. For my husband and I, we paid for 2 drinks, 2 steaks with tiny yucas $250 not including tips
We just had a delicious Sunday brunch here. Simple, quality ingredients and a pleasant outdoor seating
I don‚Äôt even understand who are the people that leave good reviews. Food is horrible, service even more horrible.

Married to an Italian here (sic), so I can tell the food is the closest to Italy that I have found in NYC. Real italian product, guanciale not bacon, pecorino, san Marzano tomoato, mortadella etc. For the wine I highly recommend the Montepulciano. Great service too and price is line with NYC (200 dol for 2)
This is one of the most delightful and delicious dining options in NYC
Amazing food and service!!!!!!

My favorite dining spot in the neighborhood! The staff is always super kind and they treat you like you are their neighbor! I‚Äôve had breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner is here and every time it is always a hit. Great drink menu and great atmosphere!

Cute corner restaurant on the upper west side, reliable and good service. The food was pretty good but I nothing stood out as amazing from all the dishes my party had ordered. The service was good and they did a really nice job with the birthday candle and cake for my friend.
I love this place it‚Äôs so delicious!
Taralucci on the UWS has been our favorite spot for brunch for the past 8 years. We love Bruno and the whole staff!
We love this place. We have spent over ten years eating croissants and brunch here. It is our neighborhood favorite ü•ê
Loved it! Had a delicious pasta and they added extra veggies. In a super convenient and beautiful spot in the upper west side, by the museum and park
Great food, pleasant outdoor atmosphere
This tiny place packs a big punch!  Food is excellent and well presented.
Alex is awesome! He‚Äôs got a great vibe, remembers what you like, and makes the bar feel like the best spot to hang out.

I‚Äôm italian and I‚Äôve been here twice.
The first time I had an happy hour with wine, spritz and two pinse. They were really great! Our server was Martina, She was really sociable, helpful and kind. The experience was so positive that we came back to try the dinner as well.
In this case our server was Pasqualino, he was fantastic as well. We tasted many different dishes and the flavour was awesome. The ingredients are really high-quality and every bite is an explosion of flavor. I totally recommend this restaurant!!
Came here for the restaurant week lunch menu and thoroughly enjoyed their crostino and chitarra con pallotine. Chill vibes and friendly service :)

Great Food
Great Service
Short waiting time
Strongly recommend

This place is truly amazing for authentic Italian on the upper westside! It's truly remarkable how they excel and transition from breakfast & lunch and then to dinner, never skipping a beat. The food is exceptional, the service responsive and so courteous and would recommend again and again! Ciao!
One of our local favorites. The food is always perfect, but it‚Äôs the staff that keeps us coming back. Aleksei always greets us with a smile and makes us feel welcome!
Amazing Italian food and wine! Great service (Alexey is always nice!). Lovely atmosphere.
Service was great, my server was very attentive. I had the cacio e pepe which was cooked perfectly al dente. The focaccia and bread they brought was delicious and a nice touch.
Highly recommend for brunch! Great staff and food!
ü§åü§åü§åü§åü§å

Homemade pasta rolled fresh daily - the pappardelle with wild boar ragu is incredible. Owner sources ingredients from his family's region in Italy. Tiramisu is light as air with perfect coffee balance.

We ate there on restaurant week which meant a three course meal for $60. The appetizer was great. The pasta dishes were good but the pasta was a bit overcooked. The desserts were fantastic. We may go back just for the dessert. The service was great with a friendly and efficient staff.

Watch them roll fresh noodles through the window every morning. Their Sunday gravy simmers for hours with tender meatballs. Wine list features small Italian vineyards at reasonable prices. The tiramisu uses real mascarpone - light as air with just the right coffee kick.
Best place upper west. To have coffee, lunch and dinner. Great wine.

It was one of the best evenings I‚Äôve ever had.
Alexey and Ari were incredibly caring - they went above and beyond to help with the menu selection and made sure both my friend and I were well taken care of throughout the night.
Highly recommend visiting this place for a truly exceptional experience!

Excellent spot in the neighboirhood for a nice dinmer with friends or family
Very cozy bar

updated review: I gave a 5 star review to this place four years ago and have been going frequently since. The last few months their chef or something changed because the main pastas have been abysmal. Order a cacio e pepe that not only had no salt or taste, had two beard hairs too ü§Æ

Best chocolate croissants!
It‚Äôs a 100% recommended restaurant. I loved my dining experience. Special thanks to Mr. Juan for his exceptional hospitality
Buonissimo!
Had a wonderful time here this past week! Perfect place to go in the summertime and sit outside. Max provided excellent service and the Italian Spritz was delicious.

Great restaurant! Absolutely loved the vibe and the menu was great and had something for everyone! Pasta selection was great, we really enjoyed the cacio e Pepe. Our server Maxwell took great care of us!
Had a great Saturday night. The rigatoni was great and the wine recommendation was spot on. Our server Maxwell took perfect care of us. Will definitely be heading back.

Lovely experience on a beautiful Sunday evening! The atmosphere at this place transports  you straight to Italy . I walked in without a reservation by myself and was immediately greeted by the hostess Lily, who made me comfortable and brought me to a great table outside (not hiding a single diner in a corner like some other places do). I got a menu and water right away and the waiter Alex was funny and attentive and recommended a rose prosecco that was delicious. The food rounded out the experience - I will definitely be back!
Atmosphere is the only redeeming factor about this place. Food is hit or miss, miss more often than not lately. And the service is consistently terrible
Enjoyed a wonderful evening and our server max took great care. Restaurant was great and they had a great wine selection. Loved the pino noir
Good food
A bit pricey for what is offering

One of the best restaurants in the city, hands down!!! The hostess was so lovely and incredibly warm! Our server was so kind and patient; and a real trooper as my girlfriend and I were crazy enough to dine in the 87¬∫+ heat on Wednesday night (haha). Do not miss the chance to enjoy this place whether it's for food, drinks, or both!!
Went in with my friends tonight and It was so much fun!! Best aperol spritz in the city! Max was my server he was lovely and helped make our night special!!

Had dinner with some friends here last week and it was great. The food, the service, and the ambiance were all fantastic. The hostess, I believe her name was Lily, was very friendly and super helpful with recommendations. Will definitely be back.

LOVEEE this place! You can never go wrong coming to Taralluci UWS whether it‚Äôs for a brunch with friends, a quick stop for a cappuccino or spritz, or a phenomenal spread of apps and entrees for dinner. My favorites are definitely the orichetti and the lamb skewers that were just recently added to the menu, amazing! Oscar is truly incredible and makes the atmosphere very welcoming. He is so attentive and makes some of the best spritzes I‚Äôve had in the city!! Highly recommend this restaurant and will continue coming back :))

Had made reservations for NYE which had a Prix Fixe menu with a decent split of vegetarian and meat selection across three courses. We went for the early seating and it was relatively quiet on a rainy last day of the year.

Alex, our server, was friendly and was kind enough to offer us a glass of wine on the house, after he felt bad having charged full price for our little one on the Prix Fixe menu.

Food overall was pretty decent. There was a Pappardelle pasta for our little one, and a few great options for meat lovers, including a Rib-eye steak which unfortunately lacked flavor, in spite of adding their rather heavy garlic and heavy cream sauce. The lobster tail was thoroughly enjoyed by the seafood lover on our table, and was enough to knock a person out on the table next to us, who possibly had a shell fish allergy. We were glad to see the person doing fine though, towards the end of the meal. Definitely not a nice way to end the year!

Noise levels were on the average end throughout our time there, and their menu and service were pretty good, definitely on the expensive end though. Will definitely visit again sometime in the near future!

Italian transported to the UWS! Get the Rigatoni if it‚Äôs your first time here. Get the Cacio E Pepe if you appreciate peppery dishes. I loved the intentionality of the pepper‚Äîit was clearly the main flavor yet it didn‚Äôt overpower the whole dish. A+

I love the local vibe at this Tarallucci e Vino location. I visited for breakfast, lunch and dinner, it was always a nice vibe and such good food.

The eggplant tortino is to die for.

A great little Italian restaurant. Fun and unique atmosphere, dishes that are suitable for vegetarians. The service is exceptional. Great food we enjoyed it. Perfect pesto gnocchi, excellent grilled cauliflower and a pasta dish with small meatballs in a particularly delicious sauce.

An unforgettable dinner thanks to Martina!

I had the most perfect dinner at Tarallucci e Vino on the Upper West Side, and a huge part of that was thanks to our incredible server, Martina. From the moment we were seated, Martina made us feel genuinely welcome ‚Äî warm, professional, and effortlessly attentive without ever being overbearing.

She guided us through the menu with great recommendations and her knowledge of the wine list was spot-on. Every detail of the evening felt seamless and thoughtful, and her positive energy really elevated the entire experience.

It‚Äôs rare to have service that feels both polished and personal, but Martina strikes that balance beautifully. I‚Äôll absolutely be back ‚Äî and I‚Äôll definitely be asking for Martina again!

Highly recommend this spot the food(amazing gnocchi!) and ambience of everything was phenomenal !

Sono stata in questo bellissimo locale, sono rimasta piacevolmente sorpresa perch√© era tanto che non bevevo un caff√® cos√¨ buono a New York. Il servizio di Martina √® stato impeccabile, torner√≤ sicuramente!

Had a great dinner here tonight.  Was able to get a nice table outside and do some great UWS people watching while enjoying a good bottle of Cab.  Service was excellent from the hostess, the nice woman behind the bar,  and Dillan our server, all making the evening so enjoyable.  Everything we ordered was cooked perfectly.  Great night, Great atmosphere, great food.

Ci sono molti posti che fingono di essere Italiani ma questo √® uno spettacolo: profuma di Italia fin dal marciapiede. Dopo una visita al Central Park, incuriosito e affamato ho deciso di provare il men√π. Locale molto accogliente, carino, curato nei dettagli. Ottima accoglienza e soprattutto ottimo men√π. Ho scelto di assaggiare una cacio e pepe insieme ad un buon vino. Cucina eccellente. Mi sono sentito a casa. Grazie a Martina alla quale ho chiesto consiglio ed √® stata molto disponibile e preparata. La mia vacanza √® terminata ma se torner√≤ a New York di sicuro passer√≤ a trovarvi. Un italiano DOC.

Locale che ci ha catturati appena l‚Äòabbiamo visto dall‚Äôesterno. Abbiamo passato veramente un‚Äôottima serata, grazie alla qualit√† della cucina, dell‚Äôambiente, ma soprattutto grazie al personale‚Ä¶ Martina la adoriamo! √à diventata la nostra cameriera preferita qui a New York, con la quale abbiamo scoperto di condividere la stessa passione per il cibo piccante. Simpaticissima! Torneremo di sicuro a trovarla!

Had such a delicious lunch here this afternoon after visiting the Museum of Natural History! The pastas were excellent, fresh and flavorful - we had the spaghetti, carbonara, and Mafalde with mushrooms. They also served us bread with olive oil.

Service and atmosphere 10/10. Linguini, octopus and pizza were delicious. I didn‚Äôt love the salad and potatoes that came with the octopus because for me it was missing flavor but still everything 10/10. I‚Äôll be back to try other things on the menu.

Love this place. Food is always stellar and it‚Äôs well located. It‚Äôs a bit noisy at times but excellent for breakfast, lunch, and dinner !  The salads and homemade soups are my favorite for lunch. They do amazing salmon and other entrees as well.  Their homemade baked goods are insane too.

Came around for dinner and sat outside since it was nice and cool. Service from Alexsei and Dillan was excellent - they were always attentive. Had a relaxing dinner. The Funghi Flatbread was light and delicious. And the RUM Cake. Yum. Not super sweet but delectable.

We had a great dinner last night! Starting with the service, Alex was amazing! Alex was very accommodating and knowledgeable of the menu and wines.

Also, the hostess was very welcoming at the door and from the start, our group had a great experience. I really enjoyed the rose. It was light but very tasty.

The cauliflower and salmon tartare were excellent! I had the pollo for dinner and the chicken was cooked perfectly.

We had a rum cake for dessert and it was AMAZING!! rum cake for the win.

Cheers to a good experience and we will be back soon. :) A+

I went to Tarallucci & Vino today with my grandpa for a nice brunch, I had the delicious bacon quiche, one of my favorites from their brunch menu and our waiter Pasqualino suggested we pair it with a glass of Pecorino. The whole staff was warm and helpful, from the moment we stepped in the host Ari welcomed us with a beautiful smile! I highly recommend it both for brunch and dinner!

Che bello incontrare un po' di Italia in questo posto magnifico!
Cucina top (da provare la pasta chitarra con pallottine)!
Ci si sente a casa grazie ad un ambiente confortevole e curato nei dettagli.
Un merito particolare a Martina un mix incredibile di cortesia, consigli, sorrisi e battute sempre pronte üòäüîù

Tarallucci e Vino on the Upper West Side is a fantastic choice for a savory breakfast, offering both good food and an excellent dining experience. The cozy, inviting ambiance makes it an ideal spot for a relaxed morning meal, and the Farro e Quinoa is a standout dish‚Äîsurprisingly good with its nutty farro and chewy quinoa, offering a satisfying. I opt for over easy eggs on top. Beyond that, the restaurant's Italian-inspired menu likely includes other options like avocado toast, quiche, French toast, and pastries. If you enjoy a tranquil, casual setting with good food, Tarallucci e Vino is an ideal choice for a breakfast on the Upper West Side. Whether you're a regular or a first-time guest, you can expect warm, accommodating service that enhances the overall dining experience.

Amazing spot if you are looking for authentic Italian food, reasonable price and intimate dinner or lunch.
Brunch is my favorite thing though, unbeatable.
Place is clean and service is fast.
If you are looking for a quiet, original place full of sunlight, you can‚Äôt go wrong with Tarallucci e Vino.
Martina always makes my day!

I had a great time during my visit ‚Äî the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was really nice. A special shoutout to Martina, the bartender, who served me some amazing wine while I was eating. She‚Äôs super friendly and really charming, which made the whole experience even better. Definitely coming back!

This guys saved my lunch while travelling #solo in NY
Catched from the Italian #lookalike name, it turned out to be a great spot!
Genuine food, smart service, honest price.
Went for the Lunch offer, very good #valueformoney
Coffee is also great üëçüèª
5/5

My friend who is an Italian food connoisseur (also Italian!) believes this place is home to the best cacio e pepe in the city.. well, it didn‚Äôt disappoint!

Simple.. made w/ fresh sauce and just peppercorn, the texture for the cacio e pepe is just right.. taste is GOOD.. and it‚Äôs up there

Service was impeccable.. got to enjoy NYC balmy summer weather sitting outside (highly recommend)

If up for a change (and dare!) try the broccoli rabe.. has a bit of a bitter taste.. but it‚Äôs not terrible.. interesting and good for you!

Branzino was great. Burrata was fresh.. maple cheesecake w/ honeycomb crumble was ok.. feel you‚Äôre better off getting the bread pudding (from chatting with server)

Must get the eggplant appetizer!! Don‚Äôt even love eggplant and still couldn‚Äôt get enough of it

Btw our server Emir was AWESOME!

Chic and intimate wine bar lined with big windows and set on a busy corner. The service was friendly and attentive but allowed us to enjoy our privacy. The eggplant appetizer was a great share and we enjoyed the crab ravioli and branzino. Overall, a lovely time

Thanks to the reviews here and on Yelp, we opted out of dining in and ordered to go. Even so, the person taking our order had us waiting a bit to order, while they chit chatted with their colleague. The pasta we got was just ok. Carbonara was actually pretty flavorful; but the gnocchi was bland. With all the sauce that was given, it certainly LOOKS like a flavorful dish; but I could barely taste the pesto. I even saved some to take home and season, thinking it may have just been under-seasoned; but it wasn't much better. The texture of the gnocchi itself was decent, which is a positive note. Lastly, take a look at the photo. Does this look like an acceptable amount of pasta for $25 to you? It's not the worst place; but there are much better establishments for dining in the area.

The caffe latte with oat milk ‚ô• I‚Äôm not a coffee connoisseur and don‚Äôt know much about coffee, but this was just really good coffee. My friend ordered the basil pesto gnocchi and it was light and not too Al dente. I ordered the fried eggplant salad and this red lump came out hahaha. I was surprised because it was not what I expected, but it was SO much better.
A great surprise, it's one of those places where it's so pleasant that time seems to stand still. Perfect coffee, cappuccino and avocado toast. Friendly service, cozy and lovely.

Had dinner tonight at the uws location and everything was super tasty! Our server was Analu and she was very sweet and attentive. the wine selection was great, we got some tastings and we loved the wines we tried. I recommend this place!

Cena in questo ristorante italiano carino, vicino al Central park. Ho mangiato Cesare salad, Cacio e pepe con il pecorino e un vino perfetto come abbinamento consigliato da Martina, per poi finire con un buonissimo home made tiramisu! Esperienza piacevole, da rifare!

Tarallucci e Vino serves delicious homemade authentic Italian dishes. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the staff is friendly. Their wine selection is excellent and pairs perfectly with the food. A perfect spot for a tasty Italian meal in NYC!

Have come here for years and the food is nothing but delicious. They even have added new dinner item menus like lamb skewers which take me back to Abruzzo.  I always choose to sit at the bar and Oscar is beyond welcoming each time (I think he‚Äôs mainly there for brunches on the weekend ;) Overall, 10/10 and will continue to come back!

We had an amazing time at Tarallucci e Vino, and a huge part of that was thanks to Alex, who made our evening truly special. The service was attentive, professional, and welcoming, and the restaurant‚Äôs atmosphere was cozy and elegant.

The food was absolutely top-notch! Every dish was perfectly cooked, beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor. The Italian cuisine here is exceptional, and each bite was pure delight.

Huge thanks to Alex and the entire Tarallucci e Vino team for such a wonderful experience! We will definitely be coming back.
